intro: Melhania virescens, commonly known as the green melhania, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed and have a rough texture. Melhania virescens is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant floral display.
